org.hps.monitoring.ecal.eventdisplay.ui

Class CalorimeterPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.hps.monitoring.ecal.eventdisplay.ui.CalorimeterPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible

    public final class CalorimeterPanel
extends JPanel
    The class CalorimeterPanel handles the rendering of the calorimeter crystals as well as mapping colors to their values, rendering a color scale, and marking cluster crystals.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  CalorimeterPanel.Crystal
      Class Crystal holds all pertinent information needed to display a calorimeter crystal in the panel.
      private class  CalorimeterPanel.ScalePanel
      The local class ScalePanel renders the scale for the calorimeter color map.

      • addAssociation

        public void addAssociation(Association crystalAssociation)
                    throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Connects the parent crystal to the child crystal such that when the parent crystal is active, the child will be highlighted with the highlight color set in the Association object.
        Parameters:
        crystalAssociation -
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y crystal coordinates for either the parent or child crystals do not correspond to a crystal.

                      throws IndexOutOfBoundsException

        Parameters:

        iy - - The y-index of the crystal.
        energy - - The energy to add.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.

      • autoScale

        public void autoScale()
        Chooses a maximum and minimum value for the scale that goes from slightly under the smallest recorded value to the highest recorded value.

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Sets all crystal energies to zero, removes all clusters, and clears all highlighting. This does not enable disabled crystals.

      • clearCrystals

        public void clearCrystals()
        Sets all crystal energies to zero, removes all clusters, and clears all highlighting associated with an individual crystal. This does not enable disabled crystals or remove general highlighting.

      • clearHighlight

        public void clearHighlight()
        Clears any highlighting on the crystals.

      • clearSelectedCrystal

        public void clearSelectedCrystal()
        Clears crystal selection and sets it to null.

      • getCrystalID

        public Point getCrystalID(int xCoor,
                          int yCoor)
        Determines the panel crystal index of the crystal at the given panel coordinates.
        Parameters:
        xCoor - - The x-coordinate on the panel.
        yCoor - - The y-coordinate on the panel.
        Returns:
        Returns a Point object containing the panel crystal indices of the crystal at the given panel coordinates. Returns null if the coordinates do not map to a crystal.

      • getCrystalID

        Determines the panel crystal index of the crystal at the given panel coordinates.
        Parameters:
        panelCoor - - The x/y-coordinates on the panel.
        Returns:
        Returns a Point object containing the panel crystal indices of the crystal at the given panel coordinates. Returns null if the coordinates do not map to a crystal.

      • getCrystalBounds

        public Dimension getCrystalBounds()
        Returns calorimeter panel's width and height in crystals.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of crystals are on the calorimeter in width and height.

      • getNeighbors

        public Set<Point> getNeighbors(int cix,
                               int ciy)
        Gets the set of valid crystals that immediately surround the central crystal. Valid crystals must both have valid indices and also be enabled.
        Parameters:
        cix - - The x-index of the central crystal.
        ciy - - The y-index of the central crystal.
        Returns:
        Returns the neighboring crystals as a Set of Point objects, with each element containing the coordinates of a valid neighbor.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y central crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.

      • getDefaultCrystalColor

        public Color getDefaultCrystalColor()
        Gets the color that will be used for zero-energy crystals.
        Returns:
        Returns the zero-energy crystal color as a Color object.

      • getNeighbors

        public Set<Point> getNeighbors(Point centralCrystal)
                        throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the set of valid crystals that immediately surround the central crystal. Valid crystals must both have valid indices and also be enabled.
        Parameters:
        centralCrystal - - What crystal the neighbors should surround.
        Returns:
        Returns the neighboring crystals as a Set of Point objects, with each element containing the coordinates of a valid neighbor.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y central crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.

      • getSelectedCrystal

        public Point getSelectedCrystal()
        Gives the x/y indices for the currently selected crystal.
        Returns:
        Returns the x/y indices in a Point object. If no crystal is currently selected, returns null.

        public SettingsListener[] getSettingsListeners()
        Gets the list of SettingsListener objects attached to the component.
        Returns:

      • isCrystalCluster

        public boolean isCrystalCluster(int ix,
                                int iy)
                         throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Determines if the crystal at the given coordinates is a cluster center or not.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The x-index of the crystal.
        iy - - The y-index of the crystal.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the crystal is a cluster center and false if it is not or if the indices are invalid.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.

      • setClusterColor

        public void setClusterColor(Color c)
        Sets the color of the cluster center marker.
        Parameters:
        c - - The color to be used for cluster center markers. A value of null will result in seed hit markers being the inverse color of the crystal in which they appear.

                              int iy,

                       throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sets whether a crystal is also the location of a cluster center.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The x-index of the crystal.
        iy - - The y-index of the crystal.
        cluster - - This should be true if there is a cluster center and false if there is not.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.

        public void setCrystalHighlight(int ix,
                                int iy,
                                Color highlight)
                         throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Parameters:
        ix - - The x-index of the crystal.
        iy - - The y-index of the crystal.
        highlight - - The color which the indicated crystal should be highlighted. A value of null indicates that no highlight should be used.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.

      • setCrystalHighlight

        public void setCrystalHighlight(Point ixy,
                                Color highlight)
                         throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Parameters:
        ixy - - The crystal's x/y-indices.
        highlight - - The color which the indicated crystal should be highlighted. A value of null indicates that no highlight should be used.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.

      • setDefaultCrystalColor

        public void setDefaultCrystalColor(Color c)
        Sets the color that crystals with zero energy will display.
        Parameters:
        c - - The color to use for zero energy crystals. A value of null will use the appropriate energy color map value.

      • setMirror

        public void setMirror(boolean mirrorX,
                      boolean mirrorY)
        Sets whether to mirror the x- and y-axes.
        Parameters:
        mirrorX - - true indicates that the x-axis should be mirrored and false that it should not.
        mirrorY - - true indicates that the y-axis should be mirrored and false that it should not.

      • setMirrorX

        public void setMirrorX(boolean mirrorX)
        Sets whether to mirror the x-axis on the calorimeter display.
        Parameters:
        mirrorX - - true indicates that the axis should be mirrored and false that it should not.

      • setMirrorY

        public void setMirrorY(boolean mirrorY)
        Sets whether to mirror the y-axis on the calorimeter display.
        Parameters:
        mirrorY - - true indicates that the axis should be mirrored and false that it should not.

      • setScaleEnabled

        public void setScaleEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether the scale should be visible or not.
        Parameters:
        enabled - - true indicates that the scale should be visible and false that it should be hidden.

      • setScaleMaximum

        public void setScaleMaximum(double maximum)
        Sets the maximum value of the color mapping scale. Energies above this value will all be the same maximum color.
        Parameters:
        maximum - - The maximum energy to be mapped.

      • setScaleMinimum

        public void setScaleMinimum(double minimum)
        Sets the minimum value of the color mapping scale. Energies below this value will all be the same minimum color.
        Parameters:
        minimum - - The minimum energy to be mapped.

      • setScalingLinear

        public void setScalingLinear()
        Sets the color mapping scale behavior to linear mapping.

      • setScalingLogarithmic

        public void setScalingLogarithmic()
        Sets the color mapping scale behavior to logarithmic mapping.

      • setSelectedCrystal

                               int iy)
        Sets which crystal is currently selected.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The x-index of the crystal.
        iy - - The y-index of the crystal.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.

      • setSelectedCrystal

        public void setSelectedCrystal(Point ixy)
                        throws NullPointerException
        Sets which crystal is currently selected.
        Parameters:
        ixy - - The crystal's x/y-indices.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Occurs when either of the given x/y crystal coordinates do not correspond to a crystal.
        NullPointerException - Occurs when the argument Point is null.

      • setSelectedCrystalHighlight

        public void setSelectedCrystalHighlight(Color c)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the color in which selected crystals should be highlighted.
        Parameters:
        c - - The new selection highlight color.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the selection color is set to null.

      • setSelectionHighlighting

        public void setSelectionHighlighting(boolean state)
        Sets whether or not the currently selected crystal should be highlighted or not.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the selected crystals should be highlighted and false that it should not.

      • setSuppressRedraw

        public void setSuppressRedraw(boolean state)
        Sets whether the panel crystals should repaint automatically whenever their state changes.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the crystal panels will repaint automatically, while false indicates that they will not repaint.

      • getMirroredPoint

        private Point getMirroredPoint(Point p,
                               boolean flipX,
                               boolean flipY)
        Mirrors the argument point across the x- and y-axes as indicated.
        Parameters:
        p - - The point to flip.
        flipX - - true indicates that the x-coordinate should be flipped and false that it should not.
        flipY - - true indicates that the y-coordinate should be flipped and false that it should not.
        Returns:
        Returns the appropriately mirrored point.

      • getMirroredX

        private int getMirroredX(int ix)
        Mirrors the argument coordinate across the x-axis.
        Returns:
        Returns the appropriately mirrored coordinate.

      • getMirroredY

        private int getMirroredY(int iy)
        Mirrors the argument coordinate across the y-axis.
        Returns:
        Returns the appropriately mirrored coordinate.

      • resetCrystalColors

        private void resetCrystalColors()
        Forces all crystals to revalidate their colors.

      • resize

        private void resize()
        Sizes and positions all of the components on the panel.

      • throwSettingsEvent

        private void throwSettingsEvent(int propertyCode)
        Creates an appropriate SettingsEvent and passes it to all attached SettingsListener objects.
        Parameters:
        propertyCode - - The int primitive representing the setting that has changed.

      • validateIndices

        private boolean validateIndices(int ix,
                                int iy)
        Indicates whether the given indices corresponds to a valid crystal or not.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The crystal's x index.
        iy - - The crystal's y index.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the indices are valid and false if they are not.

      • validateIndices

        private boolean validateIndices(Point p)
        Indicates whether the given indices corresponds to a valid crystal or not.
        Parameters:
        p - - A Point object containing the crystal's x and y indices.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the indices are valid and false if they are not.
